name: Advanced Summer Research Project in Biochemistry
description: Real-world opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge and hone technical skills through full-time research in an active research laboratory for students who have completed third year. Students are responsible for arranging for supervision by a Department of Biochemistry faculty member in advance of the academic year-end. Participants must have a minimum cGPA of 3.0 and the approval of the course coordinator. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
prerequisites: BCH340H1; BCH377H1; BCH378H1; and permission of Department
